results.name: Number of permutations of [n] having exactly 1 circular succession. A circular succession in a permutation p of [n] is either a pair p(i), p(i+1), where p(i+1)=p(i)+1 or the pair p(n), p(1) if p(1)=p(n)+1.
comment: For example, p=(4,1,2,5,3) has 2 circular successions: (1,2) and (3,4).
reference: S. M. Tanny, Permutations and successions, J. Combinatorial Theory, Series A, 21 (1976), 196-202.
formula: a(n)=n(n-1)d(n-2), where d(j)=A000166(j) are the derangement numbers.
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Sep 06 2010
